comment: Cool lady, wanna be her friend. Beware of True/False! Tries to trip you up and they make up  half your test scores. She wants you to pass but she wants you to learn it so if you show improvement she works with you. Focuses more on definitions and theorems than visual explanations/context, which was hard for me. Once it clicks though you're ok.

Dr. Dillon is by far the best math teacher I will ever have. Which is why I'm slightly embarrassed I didn't make an A as a math major. She is tough on theory, as she should be. Do not miss so much as one class, listen to her lecture.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dillon is a wealth of information (on and off topic). You will learn a lot if you are willing. My only complaint about the class was that it could have been faster and more in-depth. She tailored it to the engineers who needed one theory course for a minor, which is understandable. That said I hope to get someone like her as my graduate adviser.

Not a math major; Don't take her. She doesn't cover any engineering differential equations simply because "She's not an engineering person," and instead focuses on math terminology and things that don't help at all for the quizzes and tests. She did maybe 4 example problems throughout a whole semester while expecting 2 hours a night on homework....
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY

comment: Overall I think she's a tough but good teacher that teaches a tough class. She doesn't do many examples, but rather tries to get us to learn the concepts.  She'll try to find different ways to explain the concept if a student doesn't understand it. Do a lot of homework, and be ready for pop quizzes.  You gotta work for it if you want an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Hilarious

comment: She is one of the best math teachers I have ever had. She is really funny. She makes you learn the theory behind linear algebra, not just the calculations. She puts true and false on every test. She is hard and makes you work for your grade, but if you are willing to put in work and effort you will get a good grade.

I've been in school for 8 years and 5 majors, and Dr. Dillon is one of if, not the best professors I've had. 3 tests and a final. I missed one test  (dropped) and made C on everything else, and still walked away with a B. Grade on final will be your final grade. DO THE HOMEWORK. Tests and quizzes almost exactly like homework. Definitely take her.

After failing the first and second of 3 linear algebra tests I went and talked to her and she gave me really good advice. Do all of the homework. Every question.  Even though it may take time. We had quizzes almost every class and I noticed they were mostly all homework problems. Same went for the tests. That's the secret to the class I believe.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Professor Dillon is very energetic and passionate about math. She expects much of her students, and you have to do some of the homework and attend every class if you want to pass. The exams usually focus on theory and a couple of key formulas. There is very little partial credit on quizzes and tests. It also helps if she knows you personally.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: This rating is for Linear Algebra I, a very difficult course with a very smart professor. I have an A on my first two tests. From what I've seen from our latest test everyone's grades ranged between 85 and 4. Not even an easy C. You either get it or you don't. That being said, she is the greatest teacher I have had in math.

Meighan Dillon, she seems super nice and energetic coming in. She darts from board to board writing very quickly. Show up to class every day, and on time because there is going to be a random 5 minute quiz. DO WELL on these quizzes, She also did not really give any partial credit. STAY AWAY FROM HER if you have any difficulty in math

Dr Dillon is a true mathematician. I can see in her eyes she wants to teach her students the true nature of mathematics, which can be hard to grasp even with lots of work. She is very knowledgeable about the subject matter along with historical backgrounds of it. She grades tough but that makes you learn rigorous nature of math.

I took Prof. Dillon for linear algebra. Take her class. It's a difficult course but she gives great lectures (don't miss class) and reiterates concepts that are very abstract or bound to be on the tests. The tests are difficult but if you study hard and  pass you'll come out knowing much more than before taking the class. Also, she's really cool.

I took Dr. Dillon for Calc 1-3. Simply one of the best professors on campus. Don't misunderstand me. Her classes can be a little difficult because she expects you study, do homework and actually learn the material. However, she is also one of the most intelligent and straightforward math professors you will ever have. Not easy, but worth it.

I definitely would not recommend. She says her stuff is easy, but her lectures are more theory than actual examples. She gave a ton of quizzes, some hard some not, and all of her tests were very difficult, and her so called partial credit was not what it seemed. If you can devote all your time to class, then sure go ahead, but I suggest otherwise.

This lady is very smart and knowledgeable. The only problem is she expects everyone to be just as smart as her. Lectures are theoretical. Random pop up quizzes and very hard exams. Claims to give partial credit but its VERY partial. Unless you're aspiring to be a calc III wizard i would stay clear.

I have taken quite the multitude of classes. be it with easy teachers, and hard. She is the latter.  I find that while she is a tough grader, she is also a phenomenal teacher, i started out fairly rough, and ended up making a B.

She is a very hard teacher and getting used to her teaching style is a bit difficult. If you do the homework, go to her office hours, and get tutoring you will do fine. If she sees you making an effort she will help you out. Tests are really difficult and the random quizzes help a ton. Be prepared to work for your grade.

Had her for Calc 3, and it was UNNECESSARILY hard. Everyone said calc 3 is easer for calc 2, well I got a B in 2, and a D in 3. Her lectures are quick, more theory based, and expects you to learn half the material on your own from the book. She does give partial credit on tests, but her test are hard. I would not recommend her, she is very hard.

Horrible teacher. She expects you to know just as much as she does before she teaches it to you. You can have total confidence going into a test and come out feeling like you knew nothing. Do not take this class.
She teaches really fast and will talk until stopped. too much homework that is never graded random quizes she is a horrible teacher dont take her

This rating comes from someone who struggled with math.  Professor Dillion has a love for the class but gives a lot of hw which is never graded.. occasional pop quiz is 3-4 minutes and about 4 tests.. tutoring is a Must to pass her.  Felt like I was in an Honors class when it was only calculus 1.  Lastly she takes shortcuts w material so keep up.
She's a great teacher. It's not an easy class. It's the hardest math offered at SPSU. It will not be easy to get an A but if you work really hard it will pay off.

I got a C in her Differentials class, but I learned more than any of my friends who took different professors for the class. She is VERY hard and loves giving next to NO partial credit. Take if you have a lot of time to dedicate to her class and want to learn, otherwise take someone like Deng. (Who will still teach you but you won't do so bad. xD)
Dillon is a very good professor, but she is though. I will be taking her again for Calc II next semester.

If you don't have a forte for math or have any prior understanding to the course you may have problems. The only grades are tests and pop quizzes and no calculator can be used. Sometimes the pop quizzes will have things she never went over. 10 out of 25 people stayed in my class by the middle of the course I made the unfortunate choice of staying..

She's a very nice person, however the problem I had with her is that she didn't really tell us what to expect on an exam. I felt like her exam questions were not very clear. She does expect for you to understand the material just as good as she does. You will use the book a lot! I don't recommend her! (NO CALCULATORS)

this teacher has been the worse mistake of my life.  attendance is not required but if you are not there then you have missed out on a huge portion of the lesson.  if you have not taken calculus in high school you will fail. this is not a laid back class to get an easy a, its super hard. i would never recommend her.

Had her for Calc I. Definitely a tough class, and she is a hard teacher, but fair. She knows the material and is a very good teacher. She takes questions at the start of each class to help out. Do the homework! That and asking her about things I didn't understand were the things that got me through the class. Work hard and you can get a good grade.
She is really hard.  She gives a lot of quizzes that are not easy at all.  Prepare to be challenged.

Her class is Very hard. She is willing to help if you don't understand. You will work very hard to get a B. She does love to teach calc 3, so she isn't boring at all. Make sure you are always on top of the HW assignments. Quizzes every week. Good luck.
Extremely hard professor. The grade you get on the final exam will replace your total grade if it is above the average you have so far. If you dont do well on the final, expect a C at best.

This lady is HARD! Took her for precal and she gives 1 question quizzes every week, so if you miss it your screwed. Lots of homework, thinks you should know the subject as well as her as soon as she goes over it. I will admit that when i went to her she was reasonably helpful. Bottom line, not an easy class! You will WORK for just a B.

Stay on track with the homework or you will fail! Tests on some even problems in the book. She REALLY REALLY knows what she's talking about, and is always available to help out with questions in class or office hrs. She is VERY hard,but you'll leave her class knowing more than you from any other teacher. Take her if you seriously want to understand

I took her for both my cal classes, she is hard, but if u have questions, she will be glad to help, she even stopped while going to a school meeting to help me with something, do your work and you will be fine, but if your a slacker, choose someone else.
If you want to pass calculus 1 take someone else but her. Shes very helpful but very unclear.
shes a funny person and she is knows what shes talking about.  She is good at making things clear.  Just do the homework and the extra problems and you should do fine
No Comments
No Comments

insanely hard. she grades the homework which isnt a big deal except that she only grades the hard problems making it very difficult to get a good homework grade. her tests are also insanely hard. she was kinda mean too. i dont recommend her.

Great professor, but extremely difficult.  Possibly most challenging math teacher at SPSU.She really knows the material and makes sure her students learn it.If you pass her class,you'll really develop a better understanding for calculus.
awesome teacher, but she's very hard. you might hate her at times, but if you can make it through her class, you'll know your stuff!!
